edu.rit.m2mp
Class IncomingMessageNotifier

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mp.IncomingMessageNotifier
public class IncomingMessageNotifier
extends Object

Class IncomingMessageNotifier encapsulates a queue of messages that are received via the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP). To receive incoming messages:

  1. Create an incoming message notifier object by calling the createIncomingMessageNotifier() factory method on an M2MP Protocol object.

  2. Register one or more appropriate MessageFilters with the incoming message notifier.

  3. Call the incoming message notifier’s accept() method. This will return an incoming message that matched one of the registered message filters. See class IncomingMessage for further instructions.

  4. When done receiving incoming messages, call the incoming message notifier’s close() method.

Warning: It is very important to close the incoming message notifier when finished with it. If you stop accepting messages from the incoming message notifier but you don't close the incoming message notifier, packet buffers will leak out of the channel, and eventually the channel will no longer operate because no packet buffers are available.

Note: Class IncomingMessageNotifier is analogous to a StreamConnectionNotifier in the Java 2 Micro Edition Connected Limited Device Configuration (J2ME CLDC) Generic Connection Framework.

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Method Detail

addMessageFilter

public void addMessageFilter(MessageFilter theFilter)
Register the given message filter with this incoming message notifier. Thereafter, incoming M2MP messages that match the message filter will be accepted by this incoming message notifier.

If one or more message filters equal to theFilter are already registered with this incoming message notifier, then theFilter is registered regardless, resulting in an additional copy of the message filter being registered.

Parameters:
theFilter - Message filter to register.
Throws:
NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theFilter is null.
IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this incoming message notifier is closed.

removeMessageFilter

public void removeMessageFilter(MessageFilter theFilter)
Deregister the given message filter from this incoming message notifier. Thereafter, incoming M2MP messages that match the message filter will not be accepted by this incoming message notifier (unless they match another still-registered message filter).

More precisely, if this incoming message notifier has one or more registered message filters that are equal to theFilter, then one of those registered message filters is deregistered, and the others (if any) remain registered.

Parameters:
theFilter - Message filter to deregister.
Throws:
NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theFilter is null.
IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this incoming message notifier is closed.

accept

public IncomingMessage accept()
                       throws IOException
Obtain the next incoming message from this incoming message notifier’s queue of received messages. This method blocks until a message is available.

Returns:
Incoming message.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred. Specifically, thrown if this incoming message notifier is closed, or if the calling thread was interrupted while blocked in this method.

accept

public IncomingMessage accept(long millis)
                       throws IOException
Obtain the next incoming message from this incoming message notifier’s queue of received messages, with a timeout. This method blocks until a message is available or until the specified timeout interval has elapsed, whichever happens first. The timeout interval is millis milliseconds. If millis is 0 or less, this method will immediately return an incoming message if one is available, or will immediately return null if no incoming message is available.

Parameters:
millis - Timeout interval (milliseconds).
Returns:
Incoming message, or null if a timeout occurred.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred. Specifically, thrown if this incoming message notifier is closed, or if the calling thread was interrupted while blocked in this method.

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Close this incoming message notifier. Thereafter, it will accept no further messages. If already closed, this method has no effect.

Throws:
IOException - Thrown if an I/O error occurred while closing.

finalize

protected void finalize()
Finalize this incoming message notifier. The incoming message notifier is closed if it is not closed already.

Overrides:
finalize in class Object
